column3:
Qhoterl Pasol is despairing at the workers' clumsiness.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
Deliver the requested items to Qhoterl Pasol.

<If(Equal(IntegerParameter(4),16))><If(LessThan(IntegerParameter(1),IntegerParameter(2)))>Mine splendid mineral oil in the K'mul Astropolis<Else/>Deliver the splendid mineral oil to Qhoterl Pasol</If><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(4),17))><If(LessThan(IntegerParameter(1),IntegerParameter(2)))>Gather splendid greenwattle in the K'mul Astropolis<Else/>Deliver the splendid greenwattle to Qhoterl Pasol</If><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(4),18))><If(LessThan(IntegerParameter(1),IntegerParameter(2)))>Gather a splendid pondfrond at the Lozatl<Else/>Deliver the splendid pondfrond to Qhoterl Pasol</If><Else/></If></If></If>.
Underground caverns can be frightfully dangerous, you know! The workers are constantly tripping over and grazing their snouts and whatnot.

Thankfully, the Viis were kind enough to share a recipe for a salve that works wonders for scrapes and cuts. If you're not terribly busy, I was wondering if you'd help gather some of the necessary ingredients?
For now, I need some mineral oil, which you should be able to find near the K'mul Astropolis. There's no rush, but sooner is always infinitely preferable to later!
For now, I need some greenwattle, which you should be able to find near the K'mul Astropolis. There's no rush, but sooner is always infinitely preferable to later!
For now, I just need a piece of pondfrond, which grows in the Lozatl. It's rather difficult to find, but a fruit worm will lead you right to it. By all accounts, they're drawn to the smell!
How are those ingredients coming along?
How are those ingredients coming along?
I can tell by the spring in your step you've met with some success. Come along then, let's see what you've brought me!
Splendid! With this, I'll have a fresh batch of ointment ready in no time at all, though I cannot help but feel that, in this case, prevention would be better than cure.
Perhaps if the workers could refrain from injuring themselves at every given opportunity, there wouldn't be such high demand for the stuff. Until then, I may have need to call on your talents again!
